intro: Nyssa hollrungii, commonly known as the hollrung's tallowtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cornaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in Georgia and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves that are usually dark green on top and lighter underneath. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by orange to red berries that are an important food source for wildlife. Nyssa hollrungii is often found in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in bottomlands.
